title: Strictly fans call it fixed as Emma Weymouth gets mighty four nines from judges
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Strictly Come Dancing fans reckon they smell something fishy.

A bunch of them have taken to Twitter to vent their outrage at the epic scores won by Viscountess Emma Weymouth and her pro partner, the hunky Aljaz Skorjanec.

The judges were moved by the pair's Viennese Waltz after last week they escaped elimination by the skin of their teeth in the dance off.

Now some reckon the show's trying to keep the pair in after she won four nines from the judges and joined Karim and Amy at the top of this week's leader board.

One said: "Absolute fix. All 9s for Emma W so that there's no risk of dance off and judges won't be forced to save her again due to fixed contracts! #Strictly."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

One was furious that Emma and Aljaz scored higher than Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse, writing: "How was Emma better than Kelvin? What do these judges see? #strictly."

Another questioned if the judges could see properly: "What is it with the judges and Emma - no way she is as good as Karim. Judges go to #specsavers #Strictly."

Others, though, were more encouraging.

(Image: BBC)

One gushed: "Fabulous Waltz dance routine Aljaz Skorjanec and Emma Weymouth! Just beautiful. Flawless Jive dance routine Aljaz and Emma last week! #Strictly."

This week saw some dramatic changes in the leader board, as Saffron Barker and AJ Pritchard rocketed to the top with an almighty 38 points.

Trailing behind them are Karim Zeroual and Amy Dowden, joined in second with Emma and Aljaz.

Meanwhile, at the other end of the board are David James and Nadiya Bychkova and Mike Bushell and Katya Jones.

Will Bayley and Janette Manrara, meanwhile, had Motsi Mabuse and guest judge Alfonso Ribeiro in tears with their tearjerking performance.
description: Fans took to Twitter to slam the show for the 'absolute fix' after Emma scored a whopping 36 points
